summary: Build "ThumbnailAI", a responsive single-page web app for generating YouTube thumbnails with a live preview, style customization, AI-style suggestions, randomization, and download/export.
architectural_notes: Single-page HTML/CSS/JS front-end with live DOM-based thumbnail rendering inside a preview container.
Uses Font Awesome via CDN for icons.
"AI" generation and download are currently simulated client-side (setTimeout + alerts); backgrounds use CSS gradients.
known_issues: Download/export is not actually implemented (currently an alert suggesting screenshot).
AI generation is a simulation (random choices + delay) rather than a real AI/image generation backend.
Sign-in is a placeholder (alert) with no real authentication or modal.

existing_features.title: Build a responsive single-page UI for “ThumbnailAI” that matches the provided HTML’s information architecture: sticky header (logo + nav + sign-in), a 2-column main area (Thumbnail Preview + Customize panel) that collapses to 1 column on smaller screens, a “Why Choose ThumbnailAI?” features grid, and a footer with links.

Implement the Thumbnail Preview canvas component that renders a 16:9 thumbnail preview and updates live when the user changes: video title, channel name, selected style, or selected/preset background.

Implement thumbnail style selection with the following options: modern, minimal, bold, bright, dark, gradient. The selected style must be visibly highlighted and must change the preview text styling to match the behaviors from the provided script (e.g., font size/weight, shadows, color, and gradient text for “gradient”).

Implement “AI Suggestions” preset cards (clickbait, educational, gaming, vlog). Clicking a preset must apply a specific background gradient + style + title text update consistent with the provided HTML/JS logic.

Implement “Generate with AI” as a simulated generation action: show a loading overlay on the preview area, wait ~1.5s, then randomize background and style and pick a title from a predefined list (as in the provided script).
Implement “Randomize” to immediately randomize background + style + title (from a predefined list) and update the active style indicator, matching the provided script behavior.
Implement “Download Thumbnail” to export the currently rendered thumbnail as a real PNG at 1280x720 (16:9) on the client (no alert/screenshot instruction).
Implement a responsive header navigation with a mobile menu toggle that shows/hides the nav items and switches the toggle icon state, mirroring the provided HTML behavior.
Add Internet Identity sign-in/sign-out via the existing template hooks (without editing any immutable hook files). Replace the “Sign In” placeholder alert with actual authentication UI behavior.

Implement “Templates” functionality: allow signed-in users to save the current thumbnail configuration as a named template, list saved templates, apply a saved template to the editor/preview, and delete templates.

Visual theme: apply a cohesive dark, YouTube-inspired theme (near-black surfaces + red accent) using Tailwind styling with consistent spacing, typography scale, and component states (hover/active/disabled) across the app (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).

new_feature_requests.summary: Thumbnail preview canvas that updates live based on inputs (title, channel name, background, style)
Customization controls: video title + channel name inputs and selectable thumbnail styles (modern/minimal/bold/bright/dark/gradient)
AI Suggestions presets (clickbait/educational/gaming/vlog) that apply background/style/title changes
Generate with AI action with loading state (simulated processing) that produces a new randomized thumbnail design
Randomize button to randomize background/style/title and refresh preview
Responsive header navigation with mobile menu toggle
Templates feature: save favorite designs as reusable templates (UI link present)
Sign-in flow entry point (button) with modal/auth integration (currently placeholder)
Backend: add Motoko canister methods and stable storage for per-user templates keyed by Principal, including create/list/delete operations needed by the frontend.
